H0.text: Gills are the body part that fish use to breathe, just as insects get air through tiny holes and whales use a blow hole.

H1.text: Skin is the body part fish use to breathe, while insects use tiny holes on the sides of their bodies and whales breathe through a blowhole.

H2.text: Nose is the body part fish use to breathe, just as all animals need air to survive, insects get air through tiny holes on the sides of their bodies, and whales breathe through a blow hole.

H3.text: Mouth is the body part that fish use to breathe, just as insects get air through tiny holes on the sides of their bodies and whales breathe through a blowhole.

A4.text: The gills of fish form a number of slits connecting the pharynx to the outside of the animal on either side of the fish behind the head.
